alert.note: Alert for Northern Dona Ana County; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 5:29PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Dona Ana County through 615 PM MDT... At 528 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mesilla, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, NMSU Main Campus, Dona Ana, Mesquite, Mesilla, San Miguel, Fairacres, La Mesa, Talavera, Afton Generating Plant, East Mesa, San Pablo, Picacho, Northeast Las Cruces, Hill, Dripping Springs, Mesilla Valley Bosque State Park, Soledad Canyon and Portions of Organ Mountains Desert Peaks National Monument. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 133 and 153. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 15. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Dona Ana County; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
